alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 11:49AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north-central Wyoming, including the Bighorn Mountains and the lower elevations of Johnson County. * WHEN...Through late Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Localized flooding is possible from heavy rainfall rates or continuous or training storms. Rainfall rates 1 to 2 inches per hour are possible, with occasional rates to 3 inches per hour. Highest rainfall totals are expected Friday.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
